column3:
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/b3a9f8592952569da50c77b277f7ab7146b6cbea

(maybe this could be taken even further, I'm not sure what you're rationale is to stop at e.g. ConnectBlock but not TestBlockValidity, but it's a good start)

@laanwj I was trying to fuzz these two functions and was unable to do so easily.

In the near future I'm certain I'll have the same issue elsewhere.
Can you also pass Consensus::Params like in #7947 ? The diff shouldn't grow much and it would save us from changing exactly the same lines twice. Should also be better for fuzzing.\n
@jtimon I made a decision not to pass Params() to keep the commit clean and obviously correct.\n

IMO the commit will remain clean and obviously correct. It's currently +11 -11, and I predict it to become +15 -13 or less. \nDo you want me to provide a fixup! commit for you to decide whether  to squash it or not?\n
@jtimon Nope I think this is as much change as I want to be in this PR.\n
If we do the thing in 2 steps, it will be about 2 commits +11 -11.\nI guess I'll open competing PR then... \n
Opened #8077 which also does ContextualCheckBlockHeader (+16 -17). I believe that's still clean and obviously correct (even if the scope is bigger).\n

If it's not too late for bikeshedding...all the times I've tried to do this, I've named the variable nTime instead of  nAdjustedTime. Not important, but would make https://github.com/jtimon/bitcoin/commits/jt easier to rebase to 0.13...\n
except... it's actually the adjusted time\n
